excerpt: This 115-m. dam, completed in 1955, created & contains Kerala's largest reservoir.
detail_description: Nestled in the picturesque Palakkad district of Kerala, Malampuzha Dam stands as a remarkable engineering feat completed in 1955. This impressive structure creates Kerala's largest reservoir, holding an astounding capacity of 226 million cubic meters. The dam is not just about its functionality; it’s surrounded by breathtaking landscapes that include lush green lawns and vibrant flower beds swaying gently in the breeze, all set against the majestic backdrop of the Western Ghats.
name: Malampuzha Dam

excerpt: Colorful water park with multiple roller coasters, a food court, wave pool & planetarium.
detail_description: Nestled in the picturesque region of Kerala, Fantasy Park is a vibrant amusement park that promises an unforgettable experience for families and thrill-seekers alike. Spanning 17 acres against the stunning backdrop of the Western Ghats, this park features over 35 exhilarating rides, including both dry attractions and water-based fun. Visitors can enjoy popular rides like Super Splash and Dragon Coaster while also indulging in delicious treats at the food court.
name: Fantasy Park

excerpt: Built in 1766 CE, this preserved fort includes a garden & walking paths, plus a temple & playground.
detail_description: Nestled in the scenic foothills of the Nilgiri mountains, Palakkad Fort is a historical gem that dates back to 1766 CE. This well-preserved structure, also known as Tipu Sultan Fort, showcases the rich architectural heritage and tumultuous history of Kerala. Surrounded by lush gardens and walking paths, it offers visitors a serene environment perfect for leisurely strolls or family outings.
name: Palakkad Fort
address: Palakkad-Koduvayur, Meenakshipuram Highway, Kenathuparambu, Kunathurmedu, Chittur-Thathamangalam, Palakkad, Kerala 678001, India

excerpt: Kalpathy or Kalpathi is a residential area in Palakkad city, Kerala, India. It is famous for the Viswanatha Swamy Temple, which is located along the banks of the Kalpathy river, one of the tributaries of the Bharathapuzha. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Kalpathy, also known as Kalpathi, is a charming residential area situated in Palakkad city, Kerala, India. The region is renowned for the Viswanatha Swamy Temple, which stands gracefully on the banks of the Kalpathy river, a tributary of the Bharathapuzha. This traditional village is famous for its agraharam and exudes an old-world charm with its ancient Brahmin houses and temples.
name: Kalpathy

excerpt: Large dam & reservoir with gardens, animal attractions, a cableway & views of the Western Ghats.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Kerala, Malampuzha Dam is a stunning marvel that offers more than just breathtaking views. This expansive dam, standing tall at 355 feet, is the largest reservoir in the state and gracefully spans the Malampuzha River. Surrounding it are lush gardens and vibrant rubber plantations that create an idyllic setting for leisurely strolls. The area is not only a feast for the eyes but also serves as a fantastic picnic spot with its amusement park and various attractions.
name: Malampuzha Dam

detail_description: Ganapathy Temple Jain Medu Vadakkanthara Palakkad is a must-visit destination in Palakkad, offering a spiritual and historical experience. The temple is renowned for its cultural significance and is surrounded by other attractions that add to the overall visit. Exploring this elegant temple can be complemented by discovering nearby places of interest, enhancing the overall vacation experience in Palakkad.
name: Ganapathy temple Jain medu Vadakkanthara Palakkad
address: QJQR+G8R, Chunnambuthara, Vadakkanthara, Palakkad, Pirayiri, Kerala 678003, India

detail_description: Kalpathy Temple, located just 3 km from Palakkad, is dedicated to Lord Shiva and is famous for its annual Rath Yatra held in November. Known as the Kalpathy Ratholsavam or Chariot Festival, this grand celebration spans over ten days and draws devotees from across the country. The temple, situated near the Kalpathy river, features giant chariots that are a renowned attraction during the festival.
name: Kalpathy Temple
address: QJVX+JGX, Chathapuram, Kalpathy, Palakkad, Kerala 678003, India

excerpt: Palakkad, or Palghat, is a city in Kerala, a state in southwestern India. The 18th-century Palakkad Fort has sturdy battlements, a moat and a Hanuman temple on its grounds. North, on the Kalpathy River, the 15th-century Viswanatha Swamy Temple is the main venue of the famous Ratholsavam chariot festival. Northeast, near Malampuzha Dam, the town of Malampuzha has a rock garden created from recycled materials.
detail_description: Palakkad, also known as Palghat, is a city in Kerala, India. The 18th-century Palakkad Fort features strong battlements and a moat, along with a Hanuman temple. Nearby on the Kalpathy River stands the 15th-century Viswanatha Swamy Temple, hosting the famous Ratholsavam chariot festival.
name: Palakkad

detail_description: Immerse yourself in the serene and spiritual atmosphere of Jainmedu Temple, an ancient Jain shrine renowned for its intricate architecture and religious importance. The tranquil surroundings offer a peaceful setting for introspection and contemplation.
name: Jainmedu

detail_description: Malampuzha Garden, located in the picturesque Malampuzha Township of Palakkad, Kerala, is a renowned tourist spot. Created by the acclaimed artist Nek Chand, this unique rock cut garden is the only one of its kind in South India. The garden boasts lush greenery, vibrant flowers, and well-kept lawns that make it a perfect place for picnics and leisurely strolls.
name: Malampuzha garden
Sree Emoor Bhagavathy Temple
address: RJ5R+6QC, Kallekkulangara, Akathethara, Palakkad, Kerala 678009, India

detail_description: Malampuzha Ropeway Station is located within the picturesque Malampuzha Garden in Palakkad district, South India. The garden is a unique creation by Nek Chand, featuring rock-cut sculptures made from recycled materials. Visitors can also admire the impressive Malampuzha Yakshi sculpture by Kanayi Kunhiraman. The ropeway offers a relaxing ride with stunning views of the dam and garden, providing a welcome respite from walking in the sun.
name: Malampuzha Ropeway Station

excerpt: Expansive garden area featuring sculptures & ornate walls with rock mosaics amid grassy surrounds.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Palakkad, the Malampuzha Rock Garden is a captivating destination that artfully combines nature and creativity. Established in 1996, this expansive garden showcases an array of stunning sculptures, intricate rock mosaics, and vibrant paintings—all conceived by the talented artist Nek Chand. Located just 800 meters from the picturesque Malampuzha Dam, it offers visitors a unique glimpse into Kerala's rich cultural heritage through its innovative use of waste materials.
name: Rock Garden

excerpt: Popular hiking destination featuring a modest waterfall & pool in forested surrounds with wildlife.
detail_description: Nestled in the lush greenery of Palakkad, Dhoni Waterfalls is a captivating hiking destination that promises an adventure through nature. To reach this serene spot, visitors embark on an 8-9 km trek through enchanting forests, guided by local forest officers who ensure safety along the way. The journey offers a tranquil atmosphere where one can appreciate the beauty of nature, although caution is advised due to potential wildlife encounters like leopards and elephants.
name: Dhoni Waterfalls
address: VJ5F+V5J, Puthuppariyaram, Palakkad, Puthuppariyaram, Kerala 678591, India

excerpt: Modern figure sculpture, carved from a single piece of granite in 1969, in the Malampuzha Gardens.
detail_description: Nestled within the verdant expanse of Malampuzha Gardens in Kerala, the Yakshi Statue stands as a stunning testament to artistic brilliance. Crafted by renowned sculptor Kanai Kanhiraman in 1969, this modern figure sculpture is hewn from a single granite block and reaches an impressive height of 30 feet. The statue embodies the enchanting spirit of Yakshi, a mythological female nature deity celebrated for her beauty and grace.
name: Yakshi Statue

detail_description: Ramanathapuram Gramam in Palakkad has a fascinating history that dates back to a romantic tale involving a Kochi Prince and a tribal girl from Palakkad. The prince's love led to his banishment from the kingdom, and when he settled in Palakkad, the brahmins of Kochi declined to officiate the ceremonies. Undeterred, he sought help from brahmins in Tamil Nadu to fulfill his desire.
name: Ramanathapuram Gramam

detail_description: British Bridge in Palakkad is a historic and picturesque landmark, built in 1852 during the time of A.B. Robinson, the Collector of Malabar. Although no longer used for vehicles, it offers a charming walking experience with stunning views of vibrant blue water reflecting its color during the day. The bridge exudes a rich historical ambiance and is perfect for capturing beautiful photos.
name: British Bridge

detail_description: The Meenwallam Water Falls is exceptionally sanitary and meticulously looked after. The water exhibits remarkable transparency, allowing visitors to take a dip. Unfortunately, at present, there are no facilities for changing clothes. Admission costs 20 rupees per person, while parking is complimentary. For an additional 120 rupees per person, guided trekking tours are offered. Although there is a small catering establishment on the premises, it remains closed during the festive occasion of Onam.
name: Meenvallam Water Falls
